title: Thunderbird 115.2.3 (64-bit) stops responding
content:
Thunderbird 115.2.3 (64-bit) stops responding. Stop Responding has been going on for a few some time. I think it began with version 115.

The occurrences are random.

A few minutes ago, I dragged an image into the message. I widened the work space to cover two screens and it froze. FORTUNATELY a significantly part of what I was working on was saved in Drafts.

Another time the computer had been sitting idle for an hour or more. I'd walked away and when I came back it was not responding. I don't know if it was online or offline.
creator: decades

title: Trouble with the filter log function
content: Good morning I use the spam filter intensively and it can't be avoided that sometimes mails are filtered out that are not spams. I then look in the filter log and can find the erroneous entry that way. At least since the last update, the log can no longer be accessed. At least because I call the log only irregularly. The last call was about 4 weeks ago. Updates are installed automatically, so always up to date. I ask for support in troubleshooting.

title: global and calendar specific reminder settings are ignored when creating a new appointment
content:
Hello guys,

I customized global and calendar specific the reminder settings to "5 days - 2 days - 12 hours - 2 hours - 1 hour".

When creating a new appointment, only the "5 days" reminder is included, the other ones are ignored.

How do I fix this, so that when creating a new appointment all my reminder settings will be included automatically to that appointment?

Thanks and greetings Les

title: Arculatváltoztatás uán nem tudok üzenetet küldeni
content: peter.h.mann@skynet.be e-mail címen, mivel fogadni tudok. Pár nappal ezelőtt arculatváltoztatás történt a Mozilla oldalon. Ez után egyik e-mail címemről sem tudok üzenetet küldeni. A következő szöveget írja ki: ". A levelezőkiszolgáló válasza: Authentication required." Minden e-mail címem helyesen volt beírva, újra beírtam, ennek ellenére továbbra sem tudok üzenetet küldeni. Mi a teendő? Hofmann Péter
creator: peter.h.mann

title: Almost all emails have disappeared from protonmail Inbox
content:
I use Thunderbird which has recently updated to 115.3.1 on Windows 10. After the update it was running correctly but suddenly all emails disappeared from all folder in one email account (Protonmail) except for the last 14 messages in the inbox. My two other email accounts are fine and all three accounts are fine on Thunderbird on my laptop and the emails are all available via the web interface to my account.

I have searched for similar problems and have tried all the advice I could find (checking folders are subscribed, checking All folders and All threads are checked, nothing in the serach or filter, repair folder etc.) and cannot recover the emails. It seems that somehow Thunderbird will not download the old emails from he IMAP server. As a last resort I deleted the account and then reinstalled it but I still only have Inbox with the 14 most recent messages.

Is there a database somewhere in the profile that I need to remove to allow Thuderbird to rebuild it?

Thanks for any help.
creator: a.g.parker

title: Thunderbird Email
content: Thunderbird forward button grayed out
creator: peters1945

title: Double Deletes and "Bouncy" Folder Contents Listing?
content:
Thanks for Thunderbird! I have contributed financially in the past but our current life situation precludes us from financial and logistical support right now. Hopefully things will eventually resolve, sooner rather than later.

Two concerns with fully updated Thunderbird SUPERNOVA (not present in versions before 115): 1) Clicking on the Delete Icon often times deletes two messages in rapid succession such that it is not detected unless I am very careful to watch the Folder Contents Listing during the delete operation. 2) The display of the Folder Contents Window "bounces" around randomly when deleting an incoming message. And most troubling, the focused element moves off of the viewable section.

Thanks in advance for keeping Thunderbird my de facto standard for email handling!

Keith L.
creator: KRLoritz

title: Calendar Help
content:
I updated to the new Thunderbird 115. I imported my folders etc with no issue with only 1 little problem - my local folders are in between my 2 email accounts and I can't seem to move it down but not a big deal.

The real problem is my calendar events. I had a very full calendar and after the update, my calendar is empty and blank. I have no idea what to do. Everything else imported fine. The calendar is the only calendar I use. Hope someone can help.

Thank you Norma

title: why do hyperlinks not open with a click?
content:
This prior question/answer was unfortunately "locked", meaning no other or better! answers could be posted for it. (IMHO this locking of threads is a very bad practice leading to many unhelpful and outdated hits when searching for an answer to a question.)

"I have Linux Mint 18.1, fresh install, imported my profile from prior Linux Mint 13. Prior to this, hyperlinks in inbox messages opened to Firefox with a click. Now, have to cut and paste.

I've set Firefox as default browser, and gone through the mozilla database, have tried all diagnostics. No luck.

Any clue?"

Fortunately, there is an other and IMHO better answer to this question, which I will provide below in a moment.

title: 115.3.1 (64-bit) on Windows 10 opens new messages as draft
content:
Thank you in advance for any thoughts you might have.

Thunderbird was running fine until a few days ago. Then it suddenly started opening Inbox messages as drafts even when moving the previous message to Mail Read. Could not locate the problem. Discovered I was running a Version of Thunderbird in the high 90s. Upgraded to 115.31 (64 bit) on Windows 10 latest update.

Same problem. I have tried every troubleshooting that I know (been using Thunderbird for about 18 years) on both versions. I can't find or think of any reason for this to start suddenly or persist after upgrade to newest version. I have a screenshot in both JPG and PDF if that helps.

Searched support without finding this issue.

Much appreciate any ideas.

title: Thunderbird :: Empty Bin / Empty Spam Missing
content:
With the newest Thunderbird a couple of glaring omissions found: there no longer is a way to empty the bin/trash or spam. One must select a group of messages and then delete appears to be the only option, when previously one could select empty bin/trash or empty spam from the right click menu.

Hope Mozilla can return these handy features.

Or is there another means to accomplish the empties such as an extension?

title: Thunderbird Export/Import loses all personal e-mail folders
content:
Thunderbird 115 was so bad that I exported my profile to a Thunderbird_profile_backup.zip on my Windows-11 laptop. I restored to Thunderbird 102.15.1. I had to re-create my profile before it would let me import my profile -- this should be fixed !!! Once I restored my profile, all of my personal e-mail folders were gone. The Export said it would also export my e-mails, but this didn't happen -- or at least the Import didn't restore them. Thunderbird 102.15.1 should be fixed to restore everything.

By the way, my e-mails were originally in a folder that I specified, not in the default folder.

title: Email sender's name is incorrect
content:
In one of my six email accounts all of a sudden 16 emails are all showing the same, but incorrect name of the sender. This is happening only on my laptop, not my desktop. In as much as they all involve an on-going real estate transaction, this is somewhat frustrating. The name shown, is actually one I correspond with in a totally different context. I've tried Repair Folder and Compact Folder as well as update, restart, etc. To clarify, the sender's address goes from <REALNAME@Correctaddress> to <INCORRECTNAME @ Correctaddress> I've checked the Address Book and it appears that the INCORRECTNAME has taken over the REALNAME. How do I correct this and prevent it from happening again, and how might it have happened?

Thanks for your help.

title: Microsoft broke 'procedure entry point SetProcessMitigationPolicy could not be located in the dynamic link library KERNAL32.dll' after rolling back from win10 to win7
content:
I just tried to upgrade from win7 to win10, hoping to get ahead of their 'defacto' kill of the free upgrade (was working up until a few weeks ago). The win10 install worked, and all software worked, but win10 could not be activated. I used the built-in 'rollback' feature to return to win7, and now Tbird has the problem shown in the subject line. Any time I click a hyperlink in an email which used to open a browser (chrome) window and go to the site, now I get the error message. I have rebooted. Per an existing thread about the general dynamic link library issue: I have reinstalled Tbird. I have deleted Tbird and reinstalled. Nothing seems to help. Any thoughts about a cure? Possibly related side note: Tbird thinks I'm still running win10. Additional side note: It broke chrome, as well (wouldn't load at all), but re-installing chrome seems to have cured that problem.

Thanks for any assistance.
creator: rv7charlie

title: Thunderbird will Not Download Frontier Emails
content:
A few days ago, thunderbird stopped downloading downloading emails from two different frontier email accounts. I've always manually entered the passwords and now when I do this the progress bar at the bottom scrolls forever and it never connects to download the emails. Sending emails through both frontier accounts with thunderbird still functions normally, and I just experimented by adding a new gmail account to thunderbird and that is downloading emails normally. Email access through the web portal is also working normally, The issue seems to be with Thunderbird.

server name: pop3.frontier.com Port: 995 user name is correct connection security: SSL/TLS authentication method: normal password

Linux Mint 19.1 Cinnamon Thunderbird 102.11.0

Nothing was changed or updated on this system, it just suddenly stopped downloading emails through Thunderbird.

I have tried: - resetting the desktop - resetting the routers (internet connection is fine otherwise, but worth a shot) - deleting the global-messages-db.sqlite file so it rebuilds - setting the accounts to automatically download emails - setting the accounts to save the login passwords - deleting old emails - trying to switch to OAuth2 (when I do the blue progress bar hangs)

Does anyone have any other suggestions to try?
creator: jmpanopticon

creator: mrivlin

title: Overwrote Thunderbird profile with Firefox
content:
Hello! When making changes in Firefox, I recreated my profile in the profile manager and pointed it to the folder containing the profile, or so I thought. It just gave me a new profile and I didn’t have time to go digging to find out what was wrong. I realised later when trying to open Thunderbird that it was the wrong folder, I pointed Firefox to my Thunderbird profile, and now I can’t use it. I’ve been setting up a Raspberry Pi as a NAS/multimedia/backup server and so have been reconfiguring everything, and so of course my Thunderbird backup is not up to date. And I use POP as most of my mail accounts are quite old and have very limited storage. So there’s nothing much on the servers. The error message is "A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile", and gives me no option to try loading my profile anyway. And I can’t try importing from the old profile into a new one.

I was using Thunderbird 91, as I depend on several addons for work stuff, and every time I update half of them stop working. I tried updating to the latest version (after making a copy of the broken profile) but still have the same problem. So my question is: how can I save my e-mails from my old profile? I understand that Firefox overwrote some of the files in the profile breaking it, but surely the mailboxes themselves must still be good?

Much thanks for any help!
creator: buggie

title: Can't Turn Off Unread Message Badges in Thunderbird 115.3.1
content:
Hello Mozilla Community,

Just upgraded to Thunderbird 115.3.1 on Linux Debian yesterday, and what I guess are called "badges" are now shown for any folder in the folder pane, that has under read messages in it.

This is new behavior as these were not present before this upgrade.

The three dots (directly above all the Unread Messages Badges) for Folder Pane Options only shows: Folder Modes Show "Get Messages" Show "New Messages" Show Total Message Count Show Folder Size Hide Local Folders Hide Folder Pane Header

Show Total Message Count and Show Folder Size allows toggling the display of these data next to the Unread Message Badges, but again there is no way that I have found to shut off (not show) the Unread Message Badges.

As always, prior to making this posting I have done web searches to try and find out how to do this, but I have found nothing.

Please help!

Kind regards, Jeffrey Bruton
creator: jeffreybruton

title: Menu Bar
content:
Hate that SuperNova update changed many of my settings and views that I have fine tuned over many years of using Thunderbird. Have fixed most, can tolerate a couple I couldn't, but I absolutely hate that the File/Edit/View/Go etc Menu bar isn't at the top where its supposed to be.

Besides annoying to look at with every other Windows software standardized with this menu bar the uppermost, its also a matter of moving the mouse and real estate - ie: if your checking your inbox and want to reply, or junk it, or forward it we now have to travel further to the top of the page.

And as well, the quick filter search bar I always liked in the Thunderbird Menu bar is now only available across the top of the message column pushing emails off the page by taking up more real estate than it used to.

Sorry Thunderbird/Moxilla but its a stuff up. There was nothing wrong with Thunderbird the way it was - reliable and standardized, and everything could be put in a place to best suit the user.
creator: symetec
